content:
Image path: ./images/sample_0.png
Question Types: ['figure/diagram']
Q: What is the ‘actual’ value per 1000, during the year 1975?
A:

The user is asking for a specific value from a line graph. I need to locate the year 1975 on the x-axis and find the corresponding value on the y-axis for the "actual" data series. First, I'll use OCR to extract all the text from the image to understand the chart's title, axes, and legend.

name: extract_text_from_image
content:
FIGURE C.2.
AGE ADJUSTED MOTOR VEHICLE ACCIDENT MORTALITY RATE CANADA
PER 1000
0.3
0.28
0.26
0.24
0.22
0.2
1950 1955 1960 1965 1970 1975 1980
ACTUAL
MULTIVARIATE PREDICTOR

The OCR output confirms the chart is about "Age Adjusted Motor Vehicle Accident Mortality Rate Canada". The y-axis is labeled "PER 1000" with values from 0.2 to 0.3, and the x-axis shows years from 1950 to 1980. The legend indicates the solid line is for "ACTUAL" data. I need to find the value for the year 1975 on the "ACTUAL" line. Locating 1975 on the x-axis and moving up to the solid line, the point aligns with the y-axis value of 0.28.
Final Answer: 0.28
